contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} The '''naxar''' (co-spelled ''nakhar'' or ''nahar'') is the name of the [[currency]] that Chechen [[separatist]]s planned for the [[Chechen Republic of Ichkeria]]. In 1994, in the [[United Kingdom|UK]], banknotes were printed in 1, 3, 5, 10, 20, 50, 100, 500, and 1000 nahar denominations, dated 1995.<ref>[http://colnect.com/en/banknotes/list/currency/971-Chechen_naxar A complete list of all Chechen naxar banknotes with its accompanied images] Colnect.com. Retrieved 2012-05-12.</ref> This currency was not put in circulation, and almost all printed banknotes stored in bank of [[Grozny]] were destroyed by the [[Armed Forces of the Russian Federation|Russian military]]. <gallery> Image:3nahar.jpg|3 nahar obverse Image:5nahar.jpg|5 nahar obverse Image:5nahar2.jpg|5 nahar reverse </gallery> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Currencies of post-Soviet states}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chechen Naxar}} [[Category:Chechen Republic of Ichkeria]] [[Category:Currencies of Europe]] {{Money-unit-stub}}
